alert.note: Alert for Osceola (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 15 at 2:44PM EST by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Osceola County through 330 PM EST... At 244 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Harmony to 7 miles southwest of Holopaw to 11 miles southwest of Lake Kissimmee. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lake Kissimmee, Lake Marian, Holopaw, Kenansville and Harmony. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 PM EST for east central Florida.
